| HistoryText             = When the [[M-Pox]] crisis broke out, [[Someday Enterprises (Earth-616)|Someday Enterprises]] took advantage of the despair experienced by numerous [[Homo superior|mutants]], and offered them the opportunity to be placed in stasis and be guarded until the crisis was adverted; however, Someday additionally used the sleeper mutants as guinea pigs, managing to weaponize them.

[[Bennet du Paris (Earth-616)|Exodus]] took over Someday's operations and woke up the Sleepers, but subjugated them telepathically, with the intention to use them to attack an anti-mutant rally and incite government action.{{r|Uncanny X-Men Vol 4 13}} When [[Max Eisenhardt (Earth-616)|Magneto]]'s [[X-Men (Magneto's) (Earth-616)|X-Men]] infiltrated [[Someday Corporation Research Station|Someday's research station]] in the [[Atlantic Ocean]], they were attacked by the Sleepers.{{r|Uncanny X-Men Vol 4 12}} The X-Men managed to abduct one of the Sleepers, [[Bu Jun (Earth-616)|Bu Jun]].

The combined efforts of [[Elizabeth Braddock (Earth-616)|Psylocke]] and [[Monet St. Croix (Earth-616)|M]] revealed Exodus' involvement with the Sleepers, while [[Raven Darkholme (Earth-616)|Mystique]] infiltrated [[Someday Corporation Research Facility|another Someday base]] in the [[Sierra Nevada]] of [[California (State)|California]] as Bu Jun and made that discovery on her own.{{r|Uncanny X-Men Vol 4 13}}

Magneto tracked down Exodus to force him release the Sleepers under his command while his X-Men protected the innocents at the anti-mutant rally. Once Magneto defeated Exodus, the Sleepers were freed from his control. He later put them under [[Shen Xorn (Earth-616)|Xorn]]'s care in [[Tibet]], with the intention to have them protected while at the same time having them at his disposal in case the were needed.{{r|Uncanny X-Men Vol 4 14}}

When the united X-Men factions launched an attack on [[New Attilan]] as part of a plan to destroy the [[Terrigen Mist|Terrigen Cloud]] that caused M-Pox, he had Xorn and the Sleepers march and become the overseers of the [[Inhumans (Inhomo supremis)|Inhuman]] population held captive at their home.{{r|Uncanny X-Men Vol 4 18}}

Following the [[Inhumans vs. X-Men|conflict with the Inhumans]], Xorn relocated to the [[Blue Area of the Moon|Blue Area]] of the [[Luna (Moon)|Moon]] and left the Sleepers under the command of [[Warren Worthington III (Earth-616)|Archangel]].{{r|Uncanny X-Men Vol 4 19}}
